= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals
= causative action by which humans strike an object repeatedly with an axe, chisel, or a similar sharp tool ► in order to cut it down or alter its shape
= any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit
= state in which one's hand, which holds an instrument like an axe, is raised ► with the purpose of striking it against another object
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= wooden handle with an iron (בַּרְזֶל) blade, sharpened on one face, parallel to the handle; ► used for cutting down trees and shaping wood or stone
= causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object
= any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit
= a strong, hard magnetic silvery grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence
= a single piece of wood taken from a tree, cut and finished, and used for building and construction
= process by which humans or objects come upon (other) humans or objects without searching

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance

Node.gloss: to be alive|to become alive|to live

Node.gloss: kinship redeemer|to fulfil one's duty as kinsman|avenger
Node.definition: = a person with the duty to help close relatives regain possession of objects that used to be theirs but that have become someone else's property, which may include their own personal freedom; this person also has the responsibility to avenge the death of a relative, which can also be seen as an act of redemption
= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X is located or takes place behind Y
= person who takes the life of another human

literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= action by which humans succeed to catch up with other humans after having pursued them
literally: road; hence: = the space between two places

= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= state in which humans are not held responsible for actions committed in the past or for future commitments

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
